title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design. An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'default value' field, such as '55/66/9999', the system does not reject the input and instead stores it in the report design.
EB: The report design should reject invalid date/time strings entered in the 'default value' field for 'DateTime' type report parameters.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter.
3. In the 'Default Value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Save the report design.
5. Verify if the invalid date string is stored correctly in the report design.
